body: Just wait for tests before merging.
minor changes, self approving and merging in.

Hi Chen,
This seems extremely specific. Should we talk about the correct way of doing this kind of transformations?
Primarily test additions and minor addition to GobblinServiceManager and Compiler. Self approving.
Trivial change for an assert condition.
Pair reviewed with Hung. Merging in.
@ibuenros , under what conditions will there be misconfigurations? That "remove locks" will only be executed when people call "gobblin-standalone.sh stop".

I believe they are already published elsewhere as the build fails when this code is included and the jars are published to maven with ```./gradlew clean build uploadArchives -PgobblinFlavor=cluster -PuseHadoop2 -PhadoopVersion=2.7.2 -Dorg.gradle.java.home=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.8.0_121.jdk/Contents/Home -PjdkVersion=1.8 -PpublishToMaven -PartifactRepository=http://localhost:8081/artifactory/libs-release-local -PartifactSnapshotRepository=http://localhost:8081/artifactory/libs-snapshot-local -PdoNotSignArtifacts -x test -x javadoc -x findbugsMain```
Drop this PR per Zhixiong's request as a new PR (https://github.com/linkedin/gobblin/pull/1819) is set up.
@eogren what is the status of this PR?
@shirshanka @eogren @htran1 can you take a look when you have time?
Merging to get this in before vacation, but will appreciate post-commit review!

It would be ideal if the classpath scanner package list could be configured.  Trying to add a new implementation of a class that is loaded via Alias doesn't work currently unless I put it within the gobblin package.  The same is true when trying to use this in another context.
@abti can you take a look? It's very short, but you know more about YARN execution I think.
@abti I added the test, Can you review again?
@fermich you need to make sure that environment variable `HADOOP_HOME` is defined. You can check the classpath Gobblin will use by running `bin/gobblin classpath`
Merging. Will make changes later if needed.
@eogren @htran1 can I get a review for this? It will get harder to commit as time passes.

Thanks for taking a look @ibuenros 

I've pushed the images for the 0.9.0 and 0.10.0 release to Docker Hub: https://hub.docker.com/u/gobblin/

Doesn't look like I have merge permissions anymore, could you merge this?
@ydai1124 can you review? @shirshanka you might be interested.
Trivial changes. Just added classes to test performance.
@ibuenros : High level question is how are you planning to mitigate risk with this change to the core pipeline?

@shirshanka the plan was to do it through testing, but I understand even that is risky. An alternative is to leave the old pipeline and put a configuration switch, but I don't know how ugly that may get
@ibuenros : I'd like to think through how we might do that... maybe a new Task impl ?

@shirshanka restored old task execution (albeit refactored into a separate method), which is the default execution method. However, it does still use `RecordEnvelopes` as that is necessary to start unifying stream and batch.
@abti @ibuenros Please take a look and let me know if the code changes are fine. Thanks!
@ibuenros @yukuai518 Please review. This will unblock kuai from working on the ambry join converter
going to merge this to unblock work but comments still appreciated.
@aditya1105 will this cause immediate job failure? If so, we don't want that behavior.
@cvaliente is this PR still valid? I saw @sahilTakiar commented on the original issue.
@eogren this should no longer be needed? all records are wrapped now.
@ibuenros no, this is not needed any more.
@autumnust what's the status of this PR?
@yukuai518 what is the status of this PR?
@ibuenros gobblin job should fail whenever such a scenario occurs. Illegal argument exception should not be catched and logged.
Can you fix the title for the PR to be more descriptive of what the changes are? The current title is only understandable inside LinkedIn.
I guess I don't exactly know when `IllegalArgumentException` is thrown. Any examples?

Mostly by com.google.common.base.Preconditions. In the current scenario, Preconditions are throwing IllegalArgumentException. Also IllegalArgumentException extends RuntimeException, so we should let it fail the job.
@ibuenros test `TextFileBasedSourceTest` failed. Can you take a look?

@ibuenros I've fixed the issue you mentioned in review.

Failed checks in one build are probably unrelated but please let me know if I can do anything else with the PR ;)
